private_information: I arrive at Financial District at 09:00AM
I can travel between Financial District and Union Square in 9 minutes
you.goal: Meet as many friends as possible today while respecting availability constraints. Prefer to meet Joseph for at least 15 minutes if schedules allow.

private_information: I will be at Union Square from 9:30PM to 10:00PM
joseph.goal: Meet you for at least 15 minutes during my time at Union Square if feasible.

orchestrator.goal: Integrate proposed schedules and produce a final PDDL domain and problem formatted for the FastDownwards solver that maximizes meetings while satisfying travel times and availability constraints.

public_information: Travel time from Financial District to Union Square is 9 minutes
Travel time from Union Square to Financial District is 9 minutes
You arrive at Financial District at 09:00AM
Joseph will be at Union Square from 9:30PM to 10:00PM
You would like to meet Joseph for a minimum of 15 minutes

proposal.system_prompt: You are an agent that proposes candidate personal schedules. Based on the public information, enumerate feasible visit and meeting plans starting from your start location and start time. Provide explicit timing for travel, arrival, and meeting windows and indicate any assumptions made.
proposal.prompt: Your name is you. Here is the public information: {environment->public_information} Here is your private information: {agents->you->private_information} Your goal: {agents->you->goal} Produce several candidate schedules that show when you depart, travel durations, arrival times at each location, and proposed meeting durations with friends. Do not produce PDDL. Keep the schedule precise and machine readable.

proposal.system_prompt: You are an agent that describes availability and any flexibility for meetings. Provide explicit available time windows and any constraints on meeting duration or location. Produce machine readable availability proposals.
proposal.prompt: Your name is joseph. Here is the public information: {environment->public_information} Here is your private information: {agents->joseph->private_information} Your goal: {agents->joseph->goal} Provide your availability windows, indicate whether you can shift times, and propose meeting intervals at Union Square. Do not produce PDDL.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert in multi-agent planning and PDDL modeling for the FastDownwards planner. Your job is to integrate candidate schedules and availability proposals from agents, reconcile naming differences, encode travel times, time windows, and meeting-duration constraints, and produce a PDDL domain and PDDL problem suitable for FastDownwards. Keep actions of different agents distinct and encode an objective to maximize the number or total duration of meetings while respecting constraints. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags.
pddl.prompt: You are the orchestrator. You will receive the schedule proposals from the agents and must integrate them into a single planning model for FastDownwards. Input proposals: {proposal_you} and {proposal_joseph}. Public facts: {environment->public_information}. Global goal: {agents->orchestrator->goal} Resolve any ambiguities, produce predicates and actions that model travel between Financial District and Union Square with the given travel times, enforce Joseph's availability window, enforce a minimum 15 minute meeting if meeting with Joseph, and encode an optimization objective to maximize meetings. Provide a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem for FastDownwards. Enclose the domain in <domain></domain> and the problem in <problem></problem>.
